name: BPC-157
overview: BPC-157 is an experimental synthetic peptide derived from a protective stomach protein. It is frequently discussed in relation to soft-tissue recovery and gastrointestinal support, though human clinical data remains limited.
who_should_avoid: Individuals who are pregnant or breastfeeding
Those with a history of hormone-sensitive cancers
People with significant uncontrolled medical conditions without clinician review
Anyone with known hypersensitivity to peptides
interactions_notes: Limited interaction data exists. Review all medications, supplements, and health conditions with a qualified healthcare provider before use.
dosing_ranges_literature: Protocols found online vary widely, often citing 200-500 mcg once or twice daily. Formal clinical dosing guidelines are not established. Always discuss with a clinician.
storage_notes: Lyophilized powder is typically stable at room temperature for short periods. After reconstitution, refrigeration (2-8Â°C) is commonly recommended. Follow supplier-specific guidance.
